archetype_name: Family Pressure Cooker Express Dinners (15–30, Mild)
name: Instant Pot Lemon Herb Chicken & Rice
description: Tender chicken thighs and fluffy jasmine rice pressure-cooked with carrots and peas, finished with fresh lemon and parsley for a mild, family-friendly dinner.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice under cold water until the water runs mostly clear; drain well.
Dice 1.5 lb chicken thighs into bite-size pieces; pat dry.
Dice 1 medium onion and 2 medium carrots.
Zest 1 lemon, then halve and juice it (remove seeds).
cook_steps: Set the pressure cooker to Sauté (Normal). Add olive oil and heat 1 minute.
Add onions and carrots; cook, stirring, 3 minutes until slightly softened.
Stir in garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add chicken thighs, italian seasoning, salt, and pepper; sauté 2–3 minutes to lightly color (no need to cook through).
Stir in the drained jasmine rice to coat with juices, 30 seconds.
Pour in chicken stock, scraping the bottom to remove any browned bits.
Scatter peas over the top; do not stir.
Cancel Sauté. Seal the lid and set to Pressure Cook (High) for 6 minutes.
Allow a 10-minute natural release, then quick release any remaining pressure and open the lid.
Fluff gently with a fork. Stir in lemon zest, 2 tablespoons lemon juice (to taste), and parsley. Adjust salt and pepper.
Let sit 3–5 minutes on Keep Warm to set, then serve.
